ygData.subject: Re: what to kill (LIGHTNING BOLT?)
ygData.msgSnippet: the only problem I see with this is at 7th lvl ROOT takes a lot of your mana, as compaired to when you are 12th or so when ROOT is much less on the scale. if
ygData.messageBody:
the only problem I see with this is at 7th lvl ROOT takes a lot of your
mana, as compaired to when you are 12th or so when ROOT is much less on the
scale.
if he brakes to root, look at how much life he has left. Also I'd say get
8th and get SHOCK of ICE and FIREBOLT, then you can solo A LOT BETTER!
7th is a hard lvl 8th is much better 12th is sweeeeeet!
not 16th . . . YET!!!!!!!!

Hey how is the SHOCK SPELL for 16th??? what kinda dmg it do?
Lightning Bolt does about how much as well ???


----- Original Message -----
From: Ken Lee <kenlee@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 29, 1999 9:39 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: what to kill


> From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
>
> If you don't take risks you'll advance but slowly. At level seven I'd
> suggest sitting in front of BB in the Queynos Hills and killing the gnolls
> that spawn there. Doing this solo STILL might get you killed at 7th.
Wolves
> are another good choice but you have to be careful of Cros Treewind. Do
the
> Root N' Shoot strat, works and will give you some running space. remember
> that if the creature breaks the root, simply recast root. Do not attempt
to
> nail it with spells while it's nibblin' on yer bum. That's my experience.
>
> Zalbar
> 15th Wizard
> Solusek Ro
>
>
